title: When is the vote on a General Election and will it pass?
text:
After weeks of trying to win votes in the House of Commons with more than 40 MPs shy of a majority, Boris Johnson has called for a general election.

The Prime Minister said it is no longer possible for the "zombie Parliament" to pass legislation, including the Withdrawal Agreement Bill that would allow the Government to deliver Brexit.

Mr Johnson has been hampered since his election by an inability to win key votes in the House of Commons.

Now he says Parliament will be given an additional week to debate his Withdrawal Agreement Bill if it approves his wish to hold an election on Dec 12.

When is the general election vote?

MPs will be asked to vote on Monday on whether the UK should hold a general election.

Under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act, an election cannot be held unless there is a two-thirds majority in Parliament.
description: After weeks of trying to win votes in the House of Commons with more than 40 MPs shy of a majority, Boris Johnson has called for a general election.
